required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Mirror Assessment of the Words Used By Patients and Physicians to Express Asthma Symptoms, According To the Patient's Level of Asthma Control In General Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the concordance of the most frequently used words by the patients and the physicians to express asthma symptoms, according to the patient's level of asthma control.

primary_outcome.measure: The concordance of the most frequently used words by the patients and the physicians to express asthma symptoms, according to the patient's level of asthma control.

study_pop.textblock: The first 2 consecutive patients seen during the GP's visit with a diagnosis of persistent asthma

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- A diagnosis of persistent asthma treated with an inhaled corticosteroid based maintenance treatment for more than 3 months
- Given his/her consent to participate to the study and who is able to answer the questionnaire in french by him/her-self.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient with a cardiac disease (congestive heart failure, coronary artery disease)
- Patient with a respiratory disease other than asthma (COPD, sleep apnea syndrome).

clinical_study.keyword: words used by patients and physicians
